channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 提出書類：バイデン政権、フロリダ州とテキサス州の法律の重要部分を見直すよう連邦最高裁に要請（Greg Stohr/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Greg Stohr / Bloomberg:
Filing: the Biden administration urges SCOTUS to review key parts of Florida and Texas laws that would restrict how social media companies moderate user content  —  - Biden administration urges review of laws in Texas, Florida  — Filing largely backs social media challenges to state laws

item.title: Simplify InventionsがSports IllustratedのオーナーであるArena Groupの株式〜65％を購入する計画。この取引には$50Mの投資と5年間〜$60Mの広告コミットメントが含まれる（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
Simplify Inventions plans to buy a ~65% stake in Sports Illustrated owner Arena Group; the deal includes a $50M investment and a five-year ~$60M ad commitment  —  Manoj Bhargava's Simplify Inventions will take a roughly 65% stake in the Arena Group  —  Manoj Bhargava, a businessman who founded …

item.title: BarstoolのCEO、エリカ・エアーズ・バダンへのインタビュー。ペンとの契約、「端っこの心地よさ」への回帰、サイトをビジネスにすることなどについて（Emily Jane Fox/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Emily Jane Fox / Vanity Fair:
An interview with Barstool CEO Erika Ayers Badan, on the Penn deal, returning to “being comfortable on the edge”, building the site into a business, and more  —  As Penn pivots from Portnoy's brand of bro-ish excess to family-friendly ESPN, Barstool is free to be itself.

item.title: Netflix、クラウドストリーミングゲームの "限定ベータテスト "をカナダと英国で開始（Jay Peters/The Verge）
item.description:
Jay Peters / The Verge:
Netflix begins a “limited beta test” of its cloud-streamed games on the web, TVs, and streaming devices from Roku, LG, Amazon, and more, in Canada and the UK  —  Netflix is kicking off the first public tests of its cloud-streamed games. … In a blog post, Netflix VP …

item.title: CBSがCBSニュースの社長にイングリッド・シプリアン＝マシューズを指名、新任のウェンディ・マクマホン直属に（Kayla Cobb/The Wrap）
item.description:
Kayla Cobb / The Wrap:
CBS names Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews as the president of CBS News, reporting directly to the newly appointed Wendy McMahon  —  This appointment comes in the wake of Wendy McMahon becoming president and CEO of CBS News and Stations  —  Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews has been named the new president of CBS News.

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙は、新規購読者をニュースのみの購読から遠ざけ、5つの消費者向け商品からなるオール・アクセス・バンドルの販売に力を注いでいる（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
The New York Times is steering new subscribers away from buying a news-only subscription, leaning into pushing its All Access bundle of five consumer products  —  If you don't like the word “bundle”, don't listen in on a The New York Times earnings call.  —  In prepared remarks …

item.title: CBSは、ニーラジ・ケムラニ氏がCBSの制作契約を追求するために退任した後、ウェンディ・マクマホン氏をCBS News and StationsおよびCBS Media Venturesの社長兼CEOに指名した（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
CBS names Wendy McMahon as president and CEO of CBS News and Stations and CBS Media Ventures, after Neeraj Khemlani stepped down to pursue a CBS production deal  —  Wendy McMahon will take on sole duties leading CBS News and stations while adding oversight of the network's domestic syndication business.

item.title: ソースCoinDesk、編集チームの45％に当たる20人をレイオフ 親会社Digital Currency Groupが売却を検討中（Frank Chaparro/The Block）
item.description:
Frank Chaparro / The Block:
Source: CoinDesk lays off 20 people, or 45% of its editorial team, as its parent company, Digital Currency Group, pursues selling the outlet  —  - Crypto media company CoinDesk has reduced its workforce as parent company DCG's plans to bring in strategic investors.

item.title: CNN、平日午後10時枠にアビー・フィリップを含む新司会者を起用し、低迷する視聴率の回復を狙い、朝、夕方、週末の番組を一新（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
CNN overhauls its morning, evening, and weekend programming with new hosts, including Abby Phillip in the 10PM weekday slot, aiming to lift sagging ratings  —  Abby Phillip, host of “Inside Politics Sunday,” will be the new anchor of CNN's 10 p.m. hour on weekdays.

item.title: エルサルバドルで報道の自由が失われるなか、親政府派のYouTubeやTikTokのインフルエンサーがオーディエンスを増やし、ナイブ・ブケレ大統領の再選を後押ししている（Megan Janetsky/Associated Press）。
item.description:
Megan Janetsky / Associated Press:
As the free press withers in El Salvador, pro-government YouTube and TikTok influencers grow their audiences, boosting President Nayib Bukele's reelection bid  —  Douglas Guzmán's TikTok feed was dotted with workout routines and videos showcasing his favorite parts of his country.

item.title: ハリウッドのストライキによる新番組制作の休止は、毎月何十本もの番組が初放送された「ピークTV」時代の後、視聴者のキャッチアップを可能にする（John Koblin/New York Times）
item.description:
John Koblin / New York Times:
The pause in production of new shows due to the Hollywood strikes will let viewers catch up after the “Peak TV” era, when dozens of shows premiered each month  —  After years of being inundated with new shows, some are using a pause in production to finally watch all the stuff they missed when it came out.

item.title: ディズニーがABC、Freeform、FXといったリニアTVネットワークを切り離す可能性、ESPNやHuluを含めるかどうか、論理的な買い手としてのプライベート・エクイティ企業など（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
How Disney could spin off its linear TV networks like ABC, Freeform, and FX, whether to include ESPN and Hulu, private equity firms as logical buyers, and more  —  There is a growing consensus among Wall Street analysts, former employees and industry experts that Disney should split in two.

item.title: 情報源ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙は、IACを筆頭とする出版社グループに参加せず、自社のコンテンツでAIを訓練する企業との交渉を試みることを決定した（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: The New York Times decided not to join a group of publishers, spearheaded by IAC, attempting to negotiate with companies training AI on their content  —  The Scoop  —  The New York Times has decided not to join a group of media companies attempting to jointly negotiate …

item.title: インターネット・アーカイブの書籍貸出プログラムに対する出版社の法廷闘争の様子、インターネット・アーカイブは出版社の「完全な書籍カタログ」を取り下げることに合意（David Streitfeld/New York Times）
item.description:
David Streitfeld / New York Times:
A look at publishers' legal fight against the Internet Archive's book lending program; the Internet Archive agreed to drop the publishers' “full book catalogs”  —  In the pandemic emergency, Brewster Kahle's Internet Archive freely lent out digital scans of its library.  Publishers sued.

item.title: 内部メモ：60ミニッツ』などの番組を監督していたCBSニュースの共同責任者ニーラジ・ケムラニが、CBSとの複数年のファーストルック・コンテンツ契約に取り組むために退任する（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Internal memo: CBS News Co-Head Neeraj Khemlani, who oversaw shows like 60 Minutes, is stepping down to work on a multiyear first-look content deal with CBS  —  The headlines coming out of CBS News will soon be guided by a new executive.  —  Neeraj Khemlani, who arrived at the Paramount Global unit …
